A word for your comfort
from your captain...
Air turbulence is occasionally encountered at jet
flight levels with little advance warning. May I sug-
gest you keep your seat belt fastened for the entire
flight in the event we do encounter some unex-
pected bumpy air or turbulence. It will also be more
convenient if you plan to sleep since the stewardess
will not have to disturb you to determine if the belt
is fastened when the sign is turned ON.
PORTABLE RADIOS
Frequency Modulated (FM) radio receivers may
not be operated while the aircraft is in flight. (All
other portable receivers, and dictating devices, may
be used while the aircraft is in flight.) The reason
FM radios cannot be used is that many of them
have circuits which radiate signals. These act like
miniature broadcasting stations. In some cases,
these signals are strong enough to interfere with
the aircraft's navigation system and cause errone-
ous readings. In recognition of this fact, the Fed-
eral Aviation Agency (FAA) has issued a Special
Safety Regulation. Portions of the regulation are
quoted for your information:
"No person shall operate, nor shall any operator
in command of any aircraft permit the operation
of, a portable frequency modulated (FM) radio
receiver on ... aircraft operated by an air carrier
or commercial operator."
Thank you for your cooperation.
I hope you enjoy your trip.
_ NORTHWEST ARLINES
PF-70
Rev. 12-64

Welcome Aboard
NORTHWEST
The total skill and energy of many people
are displayed in saying — "Welcome
Aboard Northwest Orient Airlines."
When you and your family fly Northwest,
the experience of almost a half century
of flying over land and sea travels with
you. Northwest people, whether on the
ground or in the air, are working toward
a common goal: your safety, satisfaction
and peace of mind. Their
efforts are
Northwest's guarantee that you will en-
joy modern travel efficiency at its best.
PRESIDENT,
NORTHWEST ORIENT AIRLINES
THE FAN > JET AIRLINE

properties.sfomuseum:description: Flight information packet issued by Northwest Orient Airlines, comprising:a. brochure with information regarding aircraft fleet, inflight meals, etc.; multipage booklet with pocket in back;b. flyer with information about portable radios; single-sided sheet;c. route map for domestic service routes; fold-out format.
